name: Herb-Paprika Seared Tuna with Roasted Potatoes and Green Beans
description: Pan-seared tuna steaks with a mild lemon-garlic herb rub, served alongside oven-roasted potatoes and sautéed green beans. A balanced, high-protein family plate with straightforward timing.
prep_steps: Scrub and cut potatoes into 2–3 cm chunks.
Pat tuna steak dry with paper towels.
cook_steps: Roast potatoes: Toss potatoes with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper on a baking tray. Roast 25–30 minutes, turning once, until golden and tender.
Make herb rub: In a small bowl, mix 1 tbsp olive oil, minced garlic, lemon zest, 1 tsp paprika, 1/4 tsp salt, and half the chopped parsley.
Season tuna: Rub the herb mixture over tuna steak on both sides. Set aside 5–10 minutes while potatoes finish.
Start green beans: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium. Add green beans and 2 tbsp water, cover, and steam-sauté 3–4 minutes until bright green.
Finish green beans: Uncover, season with a pinch of salt and black pepper, and cook 2–3 minutes more to lightly char. Squeeze in a little lemon juice and transfer to a warm plate.
Sear tuna: Increase skillet heat to medium-high. Add a thin film of olive oil if needed. Sear tuna 2–3 minutes per side for medium (adjust to preference).
Finish and serve: Toss roasted potatoes with remaining parsley and a squeeze of lemon. Plate tuna with potatoes and green beans; serve with extra lemon wedges.
